interface.name: rdkshell_extended_input

description.summary: The rdkshell_extended_input interface is used for receiving input from RCU devices

interface.description: This is an optional alternative to the wl_keyboard interface, it was added so we could attach more meta data about the source of the event.

enum.name: key_state

description.summary: Describes the physical or virtual state of the key that produced the key event

enum.description: There is not key repeat event, instead the shell will send multiple pressed events for the key repeat. Virtual key events are generated by the gesture recogniser if it is enabled for the given app.

entry.name: pressed
entry.summary: The key has been pressed (you'll also get this for key repeats)

entry.name: virtual_release
entry.summary: The virtual key has been released (you'll also get this for key repeats) - produced by gesture recogniser

entry.name: virtual_press
entry.summary: The virtual key has been pressed - produced by gesture recogniser

enum.name: touchpad_state

description.summary: Describes the state of the touch pad when the event was generated

enum.description: This is a tri-state describing the state of the touch pad at the time that event was generated.

entry.name: down
entry.summary: the start of a touch event

entry.name: click
entry.summary: the button beneath the touch pad has been pressed

enum.name: slider_state

description.summary: Describes the state of the slider touch pad when the event was generated

enum.description: Describes the state of the slider touchpad when the event was generated.

entry.name: down
entry.summary: the start of a touch event

event.name: key
event.description: Event generated when a key is pressed, released or repeated. Also sent for virtual key events from the gesture recogniser if enabled. This event only ever generates keys using the standard linux key code values.

arg.name: serial
arg.summary: serial number of the key event

arg.name: device_id
arg.summary: the id of the device that produced the key event

arg.name: state
arg.summary: physical or virtual state of the key

event.name: touchpad

description.summary: sends positional information and depression state of the touchpad

event.description: Sends the X and Y position and state of a touch event for the specified device to the listener.

arg.name: serial
arg.summary: serial number of the touch event

arg.name: device_id
arg.summary: the id of the device that produced the touch event

arg.name: state
arg.summary: the state of the touchpad when event was generated

event.name: slider
event.description: Sends the X position and state of a touch event for the specified device to the listener

arg.name: serial
arg.summary: serial number of the slider event

arg.name: device_id
arg.summary: the id of the device that produced the slider event

arg.name: state
arg.summary: the state of the slider when event was generated
